DataElement.preferredName: Person Receive Inhibition Or Induction Medication Substance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation as outlined in the protocol for questions related to taking drug products or substances that bring about something, interfere with, or prevent an action or response.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Receive Inhibition Or Induction Medication Substance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._To take, accept, or get something offered._The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The act of bringing about something._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Receive Inhibition Or Induction Medication Substance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The act of bringing about something.:A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.:Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.
The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The act of bringing about something.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient receiving any medi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP 1A2, 2C8, 2C9, 2C19, 3A4/5 and UGT 1A1 and 1A3, P-glycoprotein, or BCRP?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving drugs that are inhibitors or inducers of p-glycoprotein or BCRP

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient being treated with or planning treatment with strong inhibitors of UGT1A1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient taking strong inhibitors of CYP3A4 (e.g. ketoconazole, itraconazole, clarithromycin, ritonavir, indinavir, nelfinavir, and saquinavir) or strong inducers of CYP3A4 (e.g. rifampin, phenytoin, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, St. John's Wort) from 14 days prior to enrollment until the end of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are inhibitors or inducers of CYP450 enzymes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4 or fluoxetine (moderate CYP2C19 inhibitor with a metabolite that potentially causes CYP3A4 inhibition)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving, or has received in last 14 days, any medications or substances that are considered moderate or strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4/5?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient using strong CYP2C19 inhibitors (e.g., ticlopidine) or moderate CYP2C19 inhibitors (e.g., omeprazole)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving, or has received in last 14 days, any medications or substances that are considered moderate or strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4/5, not including those allowed per protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any concomitant medications that are strong inhibitors of CYP3A4 (e.g., ketoconazole, itraconazole, clarithromycin, ritonavir, indinavir, nelfinavir and saquinavir) and CYP1A2 or inducers of CYP3A4 (e.g. rifampin, phenytoin, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, St. Johnâ€™s Wort) and CYP1A2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any concomitant medications that are strong inhibitors of CYP3A4 (e.g., ketoconazole, itraconazole, clarithromycin, ritonavir, indinavir, nelfinavir and saquinavir) and CYP1A2 or inducers of CYP3A4 (e.g. rifampin, phenytoin, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, St. Johns Wort) and CYP1A2?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.6.8 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002503. ak 2022.12.21 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0001812. ak 8/4/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
